page.title: 07Farming near Donington Park
page.content: There are two farms with land adjoining Donington Park Racing Circuit, Hill Top and Donington Park farms. On both about half the land is used for grazing beef cattle and half for arable crops. There are several small deciduous copses on these farms. Both farms are within the 3 mile limit of the East Midlands Airport and, therefore, planning permission is required for any changes in the nature of the farming. On Hill Top Farm are the remains of a brickyard which supplied bricks for the building of many of the older houses in Castle Donington. Donington Park Farm now offers Bed and Breakfast facilities to visitors to the area.
